page.title: 01Sleightholme Moor East
page.content: There is no human habitation within the area, which consists of featureless moorland. The only indications of human activity are cars travelling on the Reeth to Tan Hill road and long distance walkers tramping along the Penine Way. Primary land usage is sheep grazing, attempts at land improvement can be seen on west moor, where some drainage work has been carried out. Secondary land usage is the raising of grouse for the shooting season. To assist the birds the heather is burnt systematically to provide young shoots for food and older mature plants for shelter and cover. Pennine Way is a 270 mile footpath, walked by keen ramblers in two and a half-three weeks.
